018package org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.exception;
019
020import static java.lang.String.format;
021import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.requireNonNullArgument;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.requireNotEmptyArgument;
024
025import java.io.Serial;
026import java.lang.reflect.Method;
027
028import org.apiguardian.api.API;
029import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
030
031/**
032 *  This implementation of
033 *  {@link RuntimeException}
034 *  will be thrown when an attempted operation is not valid for the current
035 *  context.
036 *
037 *  @author Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
038 *  @version $Id: IllegalOperationException.java 976 2022-01-06 11:39:58Z tquadrat $
039 *  @since 0.1.0
040 */
041@SuppressWarnings( {"ClassWithTooManyConstructors", "unused"} )
042@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: IllegalOperationException.java 976 2022-01-06 11:39:58Z tquadrat $" )
043@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.1.0" )
044public class IllegalOperationException extends RuntimeException
045{
046        /*-----------*\
047    ====** Constants **========================================================
048        \*-----------*/
049    /**
050     *  The message for the illegal attempt to perform an operation: {@value}.
051     */
052    public static final String MSG_IllegalOperation = "Illegal attempt to perform the operation '%s'";
053
054    /**
055     *  The message for the illegal attempt to perform an operation, enhanced
056     *  with an explanation: {@value}.
057     */
058    public static final String MSG_IllegalOperationWithExplanation = "Illegal attempt to perform the operation '%s' (Reason: %s)";
059
060        /*------------------------*\
061    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
062        \*------------------------*/
063    /**
064     *  The serial version UID for objects of this class: {@value}.
065     *
066     *  @hidden
067     */
068    @Serial
069    private static final long serialVersionUID = 2233464685783981770L;
070
071        /*--------------*\
072    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
073        \*--------------*/
074    /**
075     *  Constructs a new {@code IllegalOperationException} with a detail
076     *  message composed of the given operation name. The cause is not
077     *  initialized, and may subsequently be initialized by a call to
078     *  {@link #initCause}.
079     *
080     *  @param  operationName   The name of the illegally attempted operation;
081     *      usually, this is the method name. The detail message constructed
082     *      from it is saved for later retrieval by the
083     *      {@link #getMessage()}
084     *      method.
085     */
086    public IllegalOperationException( final String operationName )
087    {
088        super( format( MSG_IllegalOperation, requireNotEmptyArgument( operationName, "operationName" ) ) );
089    }   //  IllegalOperationException()
090
091    /**
092     *  Constructs a new {@code IllegalOperationException} with a detail
093     *  message composed of the name of the given operation. The cause is not
094     *  initialized, and may subsequently be initialized by a call to
095     *  {@link #initCause}.
096     *
097     *  @param  operation   The illegally attempted operation. The detail
098     *      message constructed from its name is saved for later retrieval by
099     *      the
100     *      {@link #getMessage()}
101     *      method.
102     */
103    public IllegalOperationException( final Method operation )
104    {
105        this( requireNonNullArgument( operation, "operation" ).toGenericString() );
106    }   //  IllegalOperationException()
107
108    /**
109     *  Constructs a new {@code IllegalOperationException} with a detail
110     *  message composed of the given operation name and the given
111     *  explanation. The cause is not initialized, and may subsequently be
112     *  initialized by a call to
113     *  {@link #initCause}.<br>
114     *  <br>The detail message constructed from the operation name and the
115     *  explanation is saved for later retrieval by the
116     *  {@link #getMessage()}
117     *  method.
118     *
119     *  @param  operationName   The name of the illegally attempted operation;
120     *      usually, this is the method name.
121     *  @param  explanation The additional explanation.
122     */
123    public IllegalOperationException( final String operationName, final String explanation )
124    {
125        super( format( MSG_IllegalOperationWithExplanation, requireNotEmptyArgument( operationName, "operationName" ), requireNotEmptyArgument( explanation, "explanation" ) ) );
126    }   //  IllegalOperationException()
127
128    /**
129     *  Constructs a new {@code IllegalOperationException} with a detail
130     *  message composed of the name of the given operation name and the
131     *  given explanation. The cause is not initialized, and may subsequently
132     *  be initialized by a call to
133     *  {@link #initCause}.<br>
134     *  <br>The detail message constructed from the operation name and the
135     *  explanation is saved for later retrieval by the
136     *  {@link #getMessage()}
137     *  method.
138     *
139     *  @param  operation   The illegally attempted operation.
140     *  @param  explanation The additional explanation.
141     */
142    public IllegalOperationException( final Method operation, final String explanation )
143    {
144        this( requireNonNullArgument( operation, "operation" ).toGenericString(), explanation );
145    }   //  IllegalOperationException()
146
147    /**
148     *  Constructs a new {@code IllegalOperationException} with a detail
149     *  message composed of the given operation name, and the cause.
150     *
151     *  @param  operationName   The name of the illegally attempted operation;
152     *      usually, this is the method name. The detail message constructed
153     *      from it is saved for later retrieval by the
154     *      {@link #getMessage()}
155     *      method.
156     *  @param  cause   The cause, which is saved for later retrieval by the
157     *     {@link #getCause()}
158     *     method. A {@code null} value is <i>not</i> permitted!
159     */
160    public IllegalOperationException( final String operationName, final Throwable cause )
161    {
162        super( format( MSG_IllegalOperation, requireNotEmptyArgument( operationName, "operationName" ) ), requireNonNullArgument( cause, "cause" ) );
163    }   //  IllegalOperationException()
164
165    /**
166     *  Constructs a new {@code IllegalOperationException} with a detail
167     *  message composed of the name of the given operation, and the cause.
168     *
169     *  @param  operation   The illegally attempted operation. The detail
170     *      message constructed from its name is saved for later retrieval by
171     *      the
172     *      {@link #getMessage()}
173     *      method.
174     *  @param  cause   The cause, which is saved for later retrieval by the
175     *     {@link #getCause()}
176     *     method. A {@code null} value is <i>not</i> permitted!
177     */
178    public IllegalOperationException( final Method operation, final Throwable cause )
179    {
180        this( requireNonNullArgument( operation, "operation" ).toGenericString(), cause );
181    }   //  IllegalOperationException()
182
183    /**
184     *  Constructs a new {@code IllegalOperationException} with the cause and a
185     *  detail message composed of the given operation name and the given
186     *  explanation.<br>
187     *  <br>The detail message constructed from the operation name and the
188     *  explanation is saved for later retrieval by the
189     *  {@link #getMessage()}
190     *  method.
191     *
192     *  @param  operationName   The name of the illegally attempted operation;
193     *      usually, this is the method name.
194     *  @param  explanation The additional explanation.
195     *  @param  cause   The cause, which is saved for later retrieval by the
196     *     {@link #getCause()}
197     *     method. A {@code null} value is <i>not</i> permitted!
198     */
199    public IllegalOperationException( final String operationName, final String explanation, final Throwable cause )
200    {
201        super(
202            format( MSG_IllegalOperationWithExplanation,
203                requireNotEmptyArgument( operationName, "operationName" ),
204                requireNotEmptyArgument( explanation, "explanation" ) ),
205            requireNonNullArgument( cause, "cause" ) );
206    }   //  IllegalOperationException()
207
208    /**
209     *  Constructs a new {@code IllegalOperationException} with the cause and a
210     *  detail message composed of the name of the given operation and the
211     *  given explanation.<br>
212     *  <br>The detail message constructed from the operation name and the
213     *  explanation is saved for later retrieval by the
214     *  {@link #getMessage()}
215     *  method.
216     *
217     *  @param  operation   The illegally attempted operation.
218     *  @param  explanation The additional explanation.
219     *  @param  cause   The cause, which is saved for later retrieval by the
220     *     {@link #getCause()}
221     *     method. A {@code null} value is <i>not</i> permitted!
222     */
223    public IllegalOperationException( final Method operation, final String explanation, final Throwable cause )
224    {
225        this( requireNonNullArgument( operation, "operation" ).toGenericString(), explanation, cause );
226    }   //  IllegalOperationException()
227}
228//  class IllegalOperationException
229
230/*
231 *  End of File
232 */
